result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Joshua John Michael DeRosier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Count 1 in Deferred Judgment of Conviction.
Defendant to report to Probation today August 18, 2015 by 4:00 p.m.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #15CF293.
$200.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #15CF293.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Edward Mincer, DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea   DF:  Joshua John Michael DeRosier appeared.  Court called at 10:46 a.m.  State files a Deferred Judgment of Conviction.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  DE pleads Guilty to Ct 1 & 2 in 15CF293.  Court reviews the Deferred Judgment of Conviction with the DE.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and stays the adjudication of Guilt on Ct. 1 upon the full performance of the Deferred Judgment of Conviction and finds the DE adjudicated Guilty on Ct. 2.  Court questions the DE on the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Sentencing arguments for Ct. 2. Crt orders:  

Ct. 1 Court approves and signs the 1 year Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  

Ct. 2 
- S/W 1 year probation with conditions
- AODA with any follow through and recommended treatment
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Court costs of $243 and $200 for the DNA surcharge.
- DE to pay court costs through DOC 
- DE to report to probation today 08/18/15 by 4:00 p.m. 
- 20 days to appeal
filed by ADA M. Nieskes. gme
